conbody.p: To register the Cluster Controller enter the following command on the Cloud Controller:euca_conf --register-cluster --partition <partition_name> \ --host <cluster_controller_public_IP_addr> --component <unique_name> For example:euca_conf --register-cluster --partition clusterA \ --host 173.16.45.14 --component cc-hostC

The following describes the command options:
--partition: The name the administrator assigns to the cluster. You should choose a name that describes your cluster.Â For example, the name could describe the cluster's location, purpose, or performance characteristics.
--component: The name ascribed to the Cluster Controller. This is the name used to identify the Cluster Controller in a human friendly way. This name is used when reporting system state changes which require attention. It must be globally-unique with respect to other component registrations.
--host: The public IP address of the Cluster Controller. The component name cc-hostC was chosen to accommodate Eucalyptus HA where the redundant Cluster Controller service might be registered as cc-hostD. Notice that each component name is unique in the cloud and follows the form of service_name-host_location.
